Everything You Need to Design Effective Programs

A complete toolkit for NGO program managers to create evidence-based, fundable program designs using the Logical Framework Approach.

7-Step Guided Workflow
Follow a structured process from problem definition to monitoring framework with built-in guidance at every step.
AI-Powered Assistance
Get smart suggestions, auto-completions, and consistency checks powered by AI to strengthen your program design.
Visual Problem & Objective Trees
Build intuitive cause-effect diagrams and transform problems into objectives with drag-and-drop tools.
Theory of Change Builder
Create compelling results chains that clearly show the pathway from activities to long-term impact.
Smart Logframe Matrix
Auto-generate your Logical Framework Matrix with intelligent linking between components.
M&E Framework Setup
Design comprehensive monitoring indicators with data collection plans and reporting schedules.
Professional Exports
Export your work as polished PDF reports, Word documents, Excel sheets, or presentations.
Real-time Collaboration
Work together with your team in real-time with comments, version history, and role-based access.
Sector-Specific Templates
Start quickly with pre-built templates for education, health, livelihoods, and more sectors.

The LFA Process

A Guided Journey Through Program Design

Follow our structured 7-step workflow based on the Logical Framework Approach, with built-in guidance and best practices at every stage.

Step 1

Problem Definition

Clearly articulate the central problem, its context, and who is affected.

1
Step 2

Stakeholder Analysis

Identify all stakeholders, their interests, influence, and expectations.

2
Step 3

Problem Tree

Map the causes and effects of the problem in a visual tree structure.

3
Step 4

Objective Tree

Transform problems into positive objectives and solutions.

4
Step 5

Results Chain

Build your Theory of Change showing inputs to outcomes pathway.

5
Step 6

Logical Framework

Create a complete Logframe Matrix with indicators and assumptions.

6
Step 7

Monitoring Framework

Design M&E indicators, data collection, and reporting plans.

7
Start your first program design
